function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in untreated wastewater","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Survival of covid-19 in sewage and wastewater","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Direct contact with wastewater containing microorganisms","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate supply of personal protective equipment ppe","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity of pcr determination","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variety of concentration methods for wastewater","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 rna in untreated wastewaters","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of pcr-based diagnosis in low sanitation countries","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in sars-cov-2 genetic loading in wastewater corresponding to active covid-19 cases","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on qpcr as the method of choice for detecting sars-cov-2 in wastewater.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on a single measurement solution for the rapid detection of covid-19 in sewage waters and humans.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitation to pcr-based methods for virus concentration and detection in wastewater.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risk of undetected sars-cov-2 in wastewater due to limitations in concentration and detection methods.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant issues identified for the virus quantitative analysis in wastewater and sludge matrices, indicating potential challenges in accurate virus detection and quantification in these complex environments.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex microfluidic systems with interconnected networks may be prone to contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low-cost mass production of loc-based devices may lead to compromised quality control and increased risk of device malfunction.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of lab-in-a-tube, lab-in-a-box, and lab on-a-drone systems for disease diagnosis","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid development and deployment of poct systems for pandemic diagnosis","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High lods for lassa fever, west nile fever, and influenza could lead to missed detection of the viruses in wastewater, increasing the risk of environmental contamination.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absence of a paper-based device to detect sars-cov-2 in wastewaters increases the risk of undetected viral presence in the environment and potential transmission.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex matrix in wastewaters may interfere with biosensor detection, leading to inaccurate results and potential misinterpretation of viral presence.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on pcr for detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complexity of wastewater matrix impacting detection methods","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large uncertainty in viral load in feces making it difficult to determine a typical value for wbe and comparison with clinical data","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of microfluidic cartridges and pcr-based systems for rapid testing","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of climate change on vector populations","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ecosystem disturbances and biodiversity loss","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced biodiversity and range of reservoir hosts impacting trypanosomiasis infection","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Natural disasters and armed conflicts disrupt existing medical services and contribute to landscape changes, leading to increased vulnerability to disease outbreaks.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Biological change and drug resistance","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inevitability of increased vulnerability, infection, and epidemics due to global change","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid change in technology for ecosystem surveillance","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Climate change shifting malarial zones in india","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about future vector dynamics and disease ecology","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"}]}
